pyavia.struct¶

Contents¶

pyavia.struct.hole_scf_3d

Computes the three-dimensional stress concentration in countersunk and straight shank rivet holes.

Members¶

pyavia.struct provides functions relating to structures, fatigue and damage tolerance.

pyavia.struct.hole_scf_3d(rt: float, bt: float, zt: float, rw: float, lcase: str) → float¶

Computes the three-dimensional stress concentration in countersunk and straight shank rivet holes. Original FORTRAN version developed by Kunigal N. Shivakumar and J. C. Newman, Jr. April 1991. Adapted to Python by Eric J. Whitney, April 2020.

Parameters

  • rt (float) – Hole radius to thickness ratio, \(0.25 \leq r/t \leq 2.5\).

  • bt (float) – Straight shank length to plate thickness ratio, \(0 \leq b/t \leq 1\). If bt == 1 the hole is straight shank only.

  • zt (float) – Location where stress concentration factor is required as a ratio of plate thickness, \(-0.5 \leq z/t \leq 0.5\). .. note: z is measured from the mid-plane of the plate.

  • rw (float) – Hole radius to plate width, \(r/w < 0.25\).

  • lcase (str) –

    Loading case from one of the following options:
    • Straight shank:

      • ’tension’: Remote tension.

      • ’bending’: Remote bending.

      • ’pin’: Pin (or rivet) loading.

      • ’wedge’: Wedge loading.

    • Countersunk hole:

      • ’tension’: Remote tension.

      • ’bending’: Remote bending.

Returns

scf – Three-dimensional stress concentration factor K (or SCF). Depending on load case:

  • Remote tension: \(K_t=\sigma_{max}/\sigma_t\) where \(\sigma_t\) is the remote applied stress.

  • Remote bending: \(K_b=\sigma_{max}/[6M/(t^2)]\) where M = remote applied moment per unit width.

  • Pin (or rivet) load: \(K_p=\sigma_{max}/[P/(2rt)]\) where P = pin load.

  • Wedge load: \(K_w=\sigma_{max}/[P/(2rt)]\) where P = wedge load

Note

K / SCF for simulated rivet loading is obtained by adding one-half of the SCF for remote tension S = p/(2wt) and one-half of the SCF for wedge loading (2w is total width of plate).

Return type

float
